channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: Welsh Labour conference off ahead of expected autumn peak
item.description: A thousand people were expected to attend but there are fears of a peak in cases in November.

item.title: CO2: Food and drink fears for Wales over carbon dioxide cuts
item.description: One of Britain's biggest poultry processors says there needs to be urgent action within days.

item.title: Climate change: Demolition to start on Wales' most polluted street
item.description: Preparatory work on the 23 homes due for demolition is to start following months of delays.

item.title: Aberystwyth University: Wales' first vet school opens
item.description: The first 25 students are starting their five-year degree course in Aberystwyth.

item.title: Anglesey: Man arrested after cyclist injured in A55 hit-and-run
item.description: A 60-year-old has been arrested hours after a collision left a man with life-threatening injuries.

item.title: Gwynedd: Crumbling wall above rail line sparks disaster fears
item.description: The boundary wall, which is said to need repairs, overlooks a steep bank with a railway track below.

item.title: Cardiff: Man, 19, arrested over serious sex assault
item.description: A 16-year-old girl has been released from hospital following the attack on Saturday night.

item.title: Flooding: Llanerch Bridge replacement consultation opens
item.description: Eight months after the old bridge was swept away, the council warns over funding for a new one.

item.title: Covid: Call to help young people hit by service closures
item.description: Experts warn youth services in Wales are "unsustainable" and exposed to funding cuts.

item.title: Covid: Parents to 'risk truancy fines' if school cases rise
item.description: One mum says she would keep her children off school if it kept her family "well and safe" from Covid.

item.title: Snowdonia rescue: Father raises alarm as son falls 30ft on Tryfan
item.description: The walker suffered head injuries and was drifting in and out of consciousness, say rescuers.

item.title: Climate change: Aberystwyth green department store opens
item.description: A green tour of Wales will also visit renewable energy projects, farmers and safe cycling schemes.

item.title: Drink-drivers are selfish, says Ammanford woman hit by car
item.description: Finley Taylor was hit by a drink-driver as she walked her dog with her husband.

item.title: Planes turned into graffiti canvasses by street artist
item.description: Street artist Jim Vision had an idea for what to do with planes that have ended their flying days.

item.title: Covid Passes to be compulsory at 'high risk' venues in Wales
item.description: The pass confirms your vaccination status or negative lateral flow test within the previous 48 hours.

item.title: Covid: Care homes were on their own, says widow
item.description: Running a care home during the pandemic contributed to Vernon Hough's suicide, his widow says.

item.title: Disused Carmarthenshire quarry 'needs to be protected'
item.description: There are fears wildlife will be harmed if a recycling faciity is developed at the site.

item.title: Covid: Doctor combating jab myths called Dr Death by trolls
item.description: Dr Bnar Talabani uses social media to dispel vaccine misinformation.

item.title: World Cup qualifiers: It's now or never for some of the older Wales players - Helen Ward
item.description: Veteran Wales striker Helen Ward says it feels like "now or never" for her and other senior players in their 2023 Women's World Cup qualifying campaign.

item.title: Gareth Bale: Wales and Real Madrid forward has 'important' injury, says Carlo Ancelotti
item.description: Carlo Ancelotti is unsure when Gareth Bale will return to action after suffering what the Real Madrid boss describes as an "important" injury.

item.title: Ben Flower: Former Wales, Wigan and Leigh prop retires aged 33
item.description: Wales international prop forward Ben Flower retires from professional rugby league at the age of 33.

item.title: World Rugby Sevens: Jasmine Joyce scores hat-trick as GB win series opener
item.description: Double Olympian Jasmine Joyce scores three tries as Great Britain win the Fast Four final at the World Rugby Sevens Series first round in Vancouver.

item.title: Jimmy Greaves 'put me in right direction' over addiction says ex-Spurs team-mate Cliff Jones
item.description: Former Wales international Cliff Jones says former Tottenham team mate, the late Jimmy Greaves, helped him overcome an alcohol addiction.

item.title: Ysgol Filfeddygaeth Aberystwyth yn agor am y tro cyntaf
item.description: Dywed Athro'r ysgol ei fod yn "ddiwrnod cyffrous" ac yn "benllanw blynyddoedd o waith caled".

item.title: Canfod corff wrth chwilio am ddyn ar goll ym Machynlleth
item.description: Mae teulu Antony Oldham o Benegoes wedi cael gwybod am y datblygiad er nad oes cadarnhad ffurfiol.

item.title: Gallai'r argyfwng ynni effeithio ar gyflenwadau bwyd
item.description: Dywed cwmni bwyd 2 Sisters ei bod hi'n bosib y byddan nhw'n cynhyrchu 10% yn llai o gywion o fewn dyddiau.

item.title: Ateb y Galw: Y bardd Mari George
item.description: Y bardd Mari George sy'n cael ei holi yr wythnos yma

item.title: Y Bencampwriaeth: Caerdydd 0-1 Bournemouth
item.description: GÃ´l Philip Billing yn yr ail hanner yn ddigon i sicrhau buddugoliaeth i'r Cherries yn erbyn Caerdydd.
